Note that the vertical levels for this variable correspond
to the boundaries of the equivalent scalar quantities, e.g. ta and hus.

Note that the vertical levels for this variable correspond
to the boundaries of the equivalent scalar quantities, e.g. ta and hus.
Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell .
for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)
at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.
at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
vertically integrated through the atmospheric column
at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)
at the top of the atmosphere
at the top of the atmosphere

i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

This is submitted on full levels to avoid vertical
interpolation of instantaneous data.

Physically, the radiation scheme used in this model ignores any
atmosphere above the top of the model, and treats all solar emission as
SW, implying that this field should be zero at the top of the model.
However, when solving in the presence of scattering, rounding error leaves
non-zero values, both positive and negative, of magnitude far too small to
matter.

Physically, the radiation scheme used in this model ignores any
atmosphere above the top of the model, and treats all solar emission as
SW, implying that this field should be zero at the top of the model.
However, when solving in the presence of scattering, rounding error leaves
non-zero values, both positive and negative, of magnitude far too small to
matter.

This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u
and v components of wind.

NEW DEF in LIMON: Loss of snow mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the surface melt water from snow on the ice sheet portion of the grid cell divided by the ice_sheet area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land_ice regions; report as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

Computed as the total mass of liquid water falling as liquid rain
into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean
portion of the grid cell.

+ melts * SEAWATER_DENSITY) / (100 * SECONDS_IN_DAY * aice)
* REF_SALINITY / 1000.

achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4, (m01s38i201[lbproc=128] + m01s38i202[lbproc=128] + m01s38i203[lbproc=128] + m01s38i285[lbproc=128] + m01s38i286[lbproc=128] + m01s38i288[lbproc=128] + m01s38i289[lbproc=128]), areadiv='True')
Includes primary and incloud conversion to sulphate aerosol. No incloud conversion to Aitken mode in model.

Model output is mol H2SO4, diagnostic required kg SO4.
Step 1: mol H2SO4 x mol_mass_h2so4 yields kg H2SO4.
Step 2: kg H2SO4 x (mol_mass_so4 / mol_mass_h2so4) yields kg SO4.
1+2: mol H2SO4 x mol_mass_h2so4 x (mol_mass_so4 / mol_mass_h2so4)
-> kg SO4. Cancelling common term mol_mass_h2so4 leaves the conversion as
model output (mol H2SO4) x mol_mass_so4 -> diagnostic (kg SO4).

Model output is mol H2SO4, diagnostic required kg SO4.
Step 1: mol H2SO4 x mol_mass_h2so4 yields kg H2SO4.
Step 2: kg H2SO4 x (mol_mass_so4 / mol_mass_h2so4) yields kg SO4.
1+2: mol H2SO4 x mol_mass_h2so4 x (mol_mass_so4 / mol_mass_h2so4)
-> kg SO4. Cancelling common term mol_mass_h2so4 leaves the conversion as
model output (mol H2SO4) x mol_mass_so4 -> diagnostic (kg SO4).

Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.
In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of
'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton
Chlorophyll Mass Concentration'.
Using convective cores in this model configuration.
When McICA is used with convective cores, the large-scale diagnostics contain all condensate. No need to add convective because the convection diagnostics contain zeroes.

This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid).  This field
should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested
in the Lmon and Omon tables) that account for natural exchanges between
the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., 'net ecosystem
biospheric productivity', for land, and 'air to sea CO2 flux', for ocean).

For emissions driven runs. The land fraction use here is being sampled
every 6 hours rather than being a true time average. However, this appears
to be a constant field so there is no impact for current model configurations.

The latitude coordinate is for reference only and is the
closest native grid line passing through 65.6 N, 168.7 W (Bering Strait).
The atlantic_arctic_ocean basin includes the baltic_sea and hudson_bay
basins and the right-hand half of the arctic_ocean basin (with respect to
the native model grid). The indian_pacific_ocean basin includes the
red_sea basin. This diagnostic has been calculated with respect to the
native grid and NOT with respect to true north as requested.

red_sea basin.

For instantaneous outputs, this diagnostic represents an
average over the radiation time step using the state of the atmosphere
(T,q,clouds) from the first dynamics step within that interval. The time
coordinate is the start of the radiation time step interval, so the value
for t(N) is the average from t(N) to t(N+1).

(T,q,clouds) from the first dynamics step within that interval. The time
coordinate is the start of the radiation time step interval, so the value
for t(N) is the average from t(N) to t(N+1).

This field only contains valid values from year 1916 of
the Historical period onwards. Non-zero values prior to this date should be
ignored.
An arbitrary choice between 'B-grid' or 'C-grid' but it would seem sensible to use the same throughout.
The fraction of grid cell occupied by 'permanent' ice (i.e., glaciers).
((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY)
This is requested as an 'area fraction of the sea ice surface'. Hence it is intensive, and should be multiplied at each timestep by ice area then divided by mean ice area.
As an intensive variable, this needs to be multiplied by ice area each timestep (hence hpond_ai), then divided by mean ice area.

This is a confusing variable. It is 'doubly intensive', as it depends on melt pond area. For consistency, I am going to report the requested variable, multiplied at each timestep by meltpond area and ice area (hence ipond_ai), and then divide at the end by meltpond area and ice area.
The interpretation of this variable in CICE is not obvious as CICE has two simultaneous salinity profiles (when prognostic salinity is not being used).

The latitude coordinate is for reference only and is the
closest native grid line passing through 65.6 N, 168.7 W (Bering Strait).
The atlantic_arctic_ocean basin includes the baltic_sea and hudson_bay
basins and the right-hand half of the arctic_ocean basin (with respect to
the native model grid). The indian_pacific_ocean basin includes the
red_sea basin. This diagnostic has been calculated with respect to the
native grid and NOT with respect to true north as requested.

A threshold is applied to determine whether a tile is covered in snow or not - if a tile has more than 0.1 kg/m2 of snow it is considered as covered with snow, if less then there is no snow. This means other snow diagnostics may indicate snow but this diagnostic is zero. We have not applied a threshold to the other snow diagnostics (unless explicitly noted) to preserve mass conservation.
This includes snow on the canopy of the needleleaf trees.
This includes snow on the canopy of the needleleaf trees.

achem_emdrywet(ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C,
m01s38i243[lbproc=128] + m01s38i244[lbproc=128] + m01s38i245[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i246[lbproc=128] + m01s38i267[lbproc=128] + m01s38i268[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i269[lbproc=128] + m01s38i270[lbproc=128],
cube2d=(m01s38i906[lbproc=128] + m01s38i912[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i921[lbproc=128]), sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

achem_emdrywet(ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C * CONV_C_ORGM,
m01s38i248[lbproc=128] + m01s38i249[lbproc=128] + m01s38i250[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i251[lbproc=128] + m01s38i271[lbproc=128] + m01s38i272[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i273[lbproc=128] + m01s38i274[lbproc=128] + m01s38i275[lbproc=128],
cube2d=(m01s38i907[lbproc=128] + m01s38i913[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i922[lbproc=128]), sumlev='True', areadiv='True')
Reported as Kg ORGM, using a ratio of 1.4 C/ORGM

achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4,
m01s38i238[lbproc=128] + m01s38i239[lbproc=128] + m01s38i240[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i261[lbproc=128] + m01s38i262[lbproc=128] + m01s38i263[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i264[lbproc=128], cube2d=(m01s38i905[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i911[lbproc=128] + m01s38i920[lbproc=128]),
sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

Model output is mol H2SO4, diagnostic required kg SO4.
Step 1: mol H2SO4 x mol_mass_h2so4 yields kg H2SO4.
Step 2: kg H2SO4 x (mol_mass_so4 / mol_mass_h2so4) yields kg SO4.
1+2: mol H2SO4 x mol_mass_h2so4 x (mol_mass_so4 / mol_mass_h2so4)
-> kg SO4. Cancelling common term mol_mass_h2so4 leaves the conversion as
model output (mol H2SO4) x mol_mass_so4 -> diagnostic (kg SO4).

achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_NACL,
m01s38i241[lbproc=128] + m01s38i242[lbproc=128] + m01s38i265[lbproc=128]
+ m01s38i266[lbproc=128],
cube2d=(m01s38i914[lbproc=128] + m01s38i923[lbproc=128]),
sumlev='True', areadiv='True')

important to analysis please consider the information in time-varying
variables thkcello or zfullo.

AXY: conceivably could be post-processed; better to output directly; arguably depends on how someone wants to define it (e.g. should it be the time-average of depth of O2 min, or should it be the depth of the O2 min from a time-averaged field of O2?)

calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello,
zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)

Calculated using the first annual mean
of the corresponding piControl experiment as the reference state.

m01s00i431[lbproc=128,lblev=0] + m01s00i432[lbproc=128,lblev=0]
+ m01s00i433[lbproc=128,lblev=0] + m01s00i434[lbproc=128,lblev=0] + m01s00i435[lbproc=128,lblev=0]
+ m01s00i436[lbproc=128,lblev=0]
Reported as kg ORGM/kg air using a ratio of 1.4 C/ORGM.
